page.title: 17Thrumster Masts
page.content: The skyline of the area is dominated by three masts,These structures form part of the very important Brit.Tele- communications network.All trunk calls for Caithness,Sutherland and the Orkneys have to pass through the Thrumster station.The site was chosen because it lies in a direct line from Mormond Hill near Fraserburgh to Olrig Hill near Castletown.It receives and transmits all radio signals and saves the use of costly underground cables. The station which has secret status is automatic and began operations in 1956 The B.B.C.station also lies within its perimeter fence.There are two masts supported by metal stays and sunk into 10ft.deep concrete. The taller mast is 405ft.the smaller 105ft.Each has two dishes and accept different frequency signals.The tower 90ft is for communi- cation with the North Sea Oil Rigs.
